Geography.ques: The Amazon River flows through Brazil.
The Great Barrier Reef is located in the Atlantic Ocean.
The capital of Spain is Madrid.
The highest mountain peak in Africa is Kilimanjaro.
The Great Wall of China was built during the Ming dynasty.

History.ques: Napoleon Bonaparte was the first emperor of France.
The Magna Carta was signed in the 12th century.
The first successful airplane flight was made by the Wright brothers.
The United States declared independence from Great Britain in 1776.
The Roman Empire fell in the 5th century AD.

Science.ques: The Earth is the only planet in our solar system that has a moon.
An atom is made up of protons, neutrons, and electrons.
The human body has four lungs.
Water boils at a temperature of 100 degrees Celsius.

Literature.ques: William Shakespeare wrote 'To Kill a Mockingbird'.
The 'Harry Potter' series was written by J.K. Rowling.
The protagonist of 'The Catcher in the Rye' is Holden Caulfield.
Harper Lee wrote 'To Kill a Mockingbird'.

Art and Culture.ques: The Mona Lisa was painted by Vincent van Gogh.
The Sistine Chapel ceiling was painted by Michelangelo.
The composer of 'The Four Seasons' was Antonio Vivaldi.
The 'David' statue was sculpted by Michelangelo.
The 'Starry Night' painting was created by Vincent van Gogh.

Music.ques: The Beatles were formed in Liverpool, England.
Elvis Presley was known as the 'King of Rock and Roll'.
Johann Sebastian Bach was a composer from the Romantic era.
Bob Dylan was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2016.

Sports.ques: Soccer is the most popular sport in the world.
Usain Bolt is a world-record holder in the 1500m race.
Michael Jordan is widely considered to be the greatest basketball player of all time.
Rafael Nadal is a tennis player from Spain.
The Super Bowl is the championship game of the National Basketball Association.

Movies and TV.ques: The Godfather is a movie directed by Martin Scorsese.
The TV series Breaking Bad is about a high school teacher who becomes a drug dealer.
The movie Titanic was directed by Steven Spielberg.
The TV series Friends is set in New York City.
The movie Forrest Gump stars Tom Cruise.

Technology.ques: The iPhone was first released in 2007.
Mark Zuckerberg is the CEO of Google.
The first computer mouse was invented by Douglas Engelbart.
The World Wide Web was invented by Tim Berners-Lee.
The first successful search engine was called Google.

General Knowledge.ques: The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France to the United States.
The currency of Japan is the yen.
The Taj Mahal is located in Agra, India.
The Great Pyramid of Giza is the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
The Declaration of Independence was signed on July 4th, 1776.
